sentence.Network_en: The discovery is being hailed as The Holy Grail of astronomy.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一发现圆了天文学界的一个梦想。

sentence.Network_en: This discovery led on to studies of the immune system.
sentence.Network_cn: 此发现使人们开始对免疫系统进行研究。

sentence.Network_en: This discovery seems to validate the claims of popular astrology.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个发现似乎能印证流行占星术的一些说法。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from discover, on the pattern of the pair recover, recovery

entry.def: If someone makes a discovery, they become aware of something that they did not know about before.

example.ex: I felt I'd made an incredible discovery.
example.tran: 我觉得我有一个天大的发现。

example.ex: ...the discovery that both his wife and son are HIV positive.
example.tran: 查出他妻子和儿子艾滋病病毒检测都呈阳性

entry.def: If someone makes a discovery, they are the first person to find or become aware of a place, substance, or scientific fact that no one knew about before.

example.ex: In that year, two momentous discoveries were made.
example.tran: 那一年，有两个重大发现。

example.ex: ...the discovery of the ozone hole over the South Pole...
example.tran: 南极上空臭氧洞的发现

entry.tran: (对不为人知的演员、音乐人等的)发现
entry.def: If someone makes a discovery, they recognize that an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known has talent.

example.ex: His job is the discovery and promotion of new artists.
example.tran: 他的任务就是发现并推出艺术新人。

entry.def: When the discovery of people or objects happens, someone finds them, either by accident or as a result of looking for them.

example.ex: ...the discovery and destruction by soldiers of millions of marijuana plants.
example.tran: 士兵发现并销毁了大量大麻作物

means.word_mean: 4. (law) compulsory pretrial disclosure of documents relevant to a case; enables one side in a litigation to elicit information from the other side concerning the facts in the case

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"人或小东西",常带有嬉谑性或爱称; 2. 表名词,加在形容词或r结尾的单词后,通常表示为"状态,性质等"; 3. 表形容词,加在名词后,表示"……的"

stems_affixes.word_buile: fat肥大的+y人或小东西→fatty胖子
daint+y状态,性质等→n.精美食品 adj.娇美的,挑剔的
craze狂热+y……的→crazy疯狂的
fault犯错误+y……的→adj.有过失的,有缺点的
flint极硬的东西,燧石+y……的→adj.极坚硬的
greed贪欲,贪婪+y……的→adj.贪吃的,贪婪的,渴望的
guilt罪行,内疚+y……的→adj.犯罪的,有罪的,心虚的
hill小山,丘陵+y……的→adj.多小山的;丘陵起伏的
rain雨+y……的→adj.下雨的,多雨的
sleep睡+y……的→adj.想睡的;寂静的
stead=stand站+y……的→adj.稳固的,稳定的
wind风+y……的→adj.多风的,刮风的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 多树木的,木本的,木头般的,木制的
stems_affixes.word_buile: wood木+y……的→adj.多树木的,木本的,木头般的,木制的
dog狗+y人或小东西→doggy小狗
fat肥大的+y人或小东西→fatty胖子
gran奶奶+y人或小东西→granny
kit猫+y人或小东西→kitty小猫
miss小姐,姑娘+y人或小东西→n.少女,小姑娘
old老的+y人或小东西→n.老人,陈旧之物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 矮子,特别短的东西[尤指衣,裤]
stems_affixes.word_buile: short短的+y人或小东西→矮子
batter接连重击+y状态,性质等→殴打
daint+y状态,性质等→n.精美食品 adj.娇美的,挑剔的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 投递,送交;交付,交货;分娩
stems_affixes.word_buile: deliver递送+y状态,性质等→投递,送交
difficult困难的+y状态,性质等→n.困难,困境,难题
discover发现,发觉+y状态,性质等→n.发现;被发现的事物
flatter阿谀,奉承+y状态,性质等→n.谄媚,阿谀,巴结,奉承
harmon+y状态,性质等→n.协调,融洽
inquire打听,询问+y状态,性质等→n.[enquiry]询问,打听,调查
jealous嫉妒的+y状态,性质等→n.妒忌,嫉妒,猜忌

stems_affixes.value_cn: 控制权,统治权;精通,掌握
stems_affixes.word_buile: master掌握+y状态,性质等→n.控制权,统治权;精通,掌握
recover恢复,痊愈+y状态,性质等→n.恢复,痊愈,防御

Sentence.sentence: Decades ago, Kodak anticipated that digital photography would overtake film — and in fact, Kodak invented the first digital camera in 1975 — but in a fateful decision, the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditional film business.
Every major scientific discovery began with someone imagining the world to look differently from the way others saw it.
What leads to major scientific discoveries according to the speaker?
Their discovery of the laws of cause and effect.

sentences.en: The discovery of Columbus was quite an event in the world.
sentences.cn: 哥伦布的发现是世界上的一件大事。

means.word_mean: 被发现的事物（或真相、人）

sentences.en: Many great discoveries have been made in the field of science.
sentences.cn: 在科学领域已有许多重大发现。

jushi.english: Many great discoveries have been made in the field of science.
jushi.chinese: 在科学领域已有许多重大发现。

jushi.english: The thieves thought that they had concealed the jewels from discovery.
jushi.chinese: 盗贼们以为自己已把珠宝隐藏好了。

jushi.english: A collector of rare insects will show us some of his latest discoveries.
jushi.chinese: 一位稀有昆虫收集者将给我们看他的一些最新发现。
